channel.title: CSS on Java vs GoLang
channel.description: Recent content in CSS on Java vs GoLang

item.title: Basics
item.description: Hello World Java public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, World"); } GoLang func main() { fmt.Println("hello world") } Variables & constants Java var a = 1; int b; final var hello = "Hello" GoLang var a = 1 var b Int c := 1 // inside functions const hello = "Hello" Strings I Java var name = "John"; var lastName = "Smith"; var text = "My name is: " + name + " " + lastName; var text2 = String.

item.title: Data Structures
item.description: Arrays Java String cars[] = new String[] { "Toyota", "Mercedes", "BMW", "Volkswagen", "Skoda" }; System.out.println(cars[1]); // Mercedes GoLang cars := []string{"Toyota", "Mercedes", "BMW", "Volkswagen", "Skoda"} fmt.Println(cars[1]) // Mercedes Multidimensional array Java String langs[][] = new String[][]{{"C#", "C", "Python"}, {"Java", "Scala", "Perl"}, {"C++", "Go", "HTML"}} GoLang langs := [3][3]string{{"C#", "C", "Python"}, {"Java", "Scala", "Perl"}, {"C++", "Go", "HTML"}} Lists Java List<String> letters = List.of("a", "b", "c", "d"); letters.

item.title: Structures
item.description: Basic structure Java public class Student { private String name; private int age; public Student(String name, String age) { this.name = name; this.age = age; } } GoLang type Student struct { Name string Age int } Object initialization Java var student = new Student("John", 18); GoLang student := Student{"John", 18} Optional arguments in initialization Java public class Student { private String name; private int age; public Student(String name) { this.
